context:
I think the presence of Man on Earth is apart of the 3.5 billion year process of evolution. We only live in a snap shot of that time. To say the effects of Man's activities is either good or bad is irrelevant. As we know the Earth, and the universe is in constant change. There is no perfect balance, or way things are supposed to be.
And just so you understand, if Nature gave the Whales a choice they would through us under the bus in a second.

replies.context:
Where are the cicadas?! Covid is killing them. 
This could be a break in the food chain!
God: I give you ALL of these animals for food.
Sorry, I find it very difficult to take religious people seriously.

context:
"There are only about 356 North Atlantic right whales left"

So they can count every single right whale in the stinkin' ocean but they can't get a clear picture of a UFO?

replies.context: Whales are real. UFOs are fantasies. It’s hard to get a clear picture of a fantasy.
So if an object is flying and it's unidentified it's a fantasy?

It’s certainly not beings from beyond Earth. 

There is a reason why unidentified objects are unidentified. It’s because we couldn’t get a good image of them. Duh.
Who (besides you) said anything about "beings from beyond Earth"? Duh.
That’s generally what’s going through people’s minds when they talk about UFOs but nice dodge.

Mmm...no. Again, you're the one that brought up "beings from beyond Earth".
So, let me clue you in on what you're having trouble with.
UFO stands for Unidentified Flying Object. It doesn't stand for "beings from beyond Earth" Flying Object. Sorry if this confuses you but I really can't assist you with what's going through your mind.
I had exactly the same observation

context: Oh, those terrible humans. Raspberries to them.
